BR_text.BRsummary: Missing annotation info when 'Download COCO' functionality is used
BR_text.BRdescription:
Hello,
 When I want to download all COCO json from a dataset, the annotation data is not included, any data or just some annotations. That happen in my local version as well.
 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32461935/53492884-40ea9200-3a9a-11e9-8ace-abd16e26c189.png></denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32461935/53493145-f289c300-3a9a-11e9-8089-a9ef320caac1.png></denchmark-link>
 
 Thanks.

comments_1.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jsbroks>@jsbroks</denchmark-link>
  you already fixed the bug? It still not working.

comments_2.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/AdanMora>@AdanMora</denchmark-link>
  which build image as you using

comments_3.comment_text: Sorry, maybe is that, I'm not familiar with Docker, I did again the installation erasing the containers, I also tried the update commands in the wiki, but it still not working for me, in your online test annotator it works.

comments_4.comment_text:
Every time I tag, a docker image called stable is built. Every time I make a commit, the latest tag is built.
 On <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jsbroks/coco-annotator/blob/master/docker-compose.yml#L7>line 7 in the docker-compose.yml</denchmark-link>
  you want to switch it from  to  (at the end). Then..
 <denchmark-code>docker-compose pull
 docker-compose down
 docker-compose up
 </denchmark-code>

comments_5.comment_text: I think my problem was that I was doing the Production Build, not the Development Build. I did those changes and it works, Thank you!!

comments_6.comment_text: I would just like to clarify, the latest is still a production build.

comments_7.comment_text:
Ok, I tried to say that I built the project with:
 $ docker-compose -f docker-compose.dev.yml up --build
 and it works.
 The other command didn't update the image:
 $ docker-compose up --build

comments_8.comment_text:
Did you try what I said above?
 You need to do $ docker-compose pull to update the image.
 
 Every time I tag, a docker image called stable is built. Every time I make a commit, the latest tag is built.
 On line 7 in the docker-compose.yml you want to switch it from stable to latest (at the end). Then..
 docker-compose pull
 docker-compose down
 docker-compose up

comments_9.comment_text: Yes I did it but it doesn't work with the first command, only with the other one.

comments_10.comment_text: My bad the last latest build fail, thats why it didn't fix it
